title: Bessent says debt limit measures could run out in August
description: Bessent urged Congress to ‚Äúincrease or suspend the debt limit by mid-July, before its scheduled break, to protect the full faith and credit of the United States.‚Äù
author: Daniel Flatley, Gregory Korte, Bloomberg

title: Sebi proposes allowing investment advisers, analysts to use liquid MFs for deposit requirements
description: Markets watchdog Sebi on Friday proposed allowing investment advisers and research analysts to use liquid mutual fund units, with a lien marked in favour of the regulatory body, to meet their deposit requirements. This would be in addition to the option to maintain the deposit with the bank.

title: Birla Corporation Q4 Results: Cons PAT rises 32% to Rs 256 crore
description: Consolidated net profit of Birla Corporation Limited, the flagship company of M P Birla group, increased 32.7 per cent at Rs 256.60 crore during the fourth quarter of 2024-25 as compared to Rs 193.34 crore in the corresponding previous period.

title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy on Agility, AI Strategy, and the Changing Role of Managers
description: It's a tough time to lead one of the biggest companies in the world - one that depends on supply chains, physical infrastructure, and top tech talent to stay competitive. But Andy Jassy, who took over as CEO of Amazon from legendary founder Jeff Bezos in 2021, manages in a way that he says helps him stay focused on what is best for their products and ultimately their customers. He explains his decision to get workers back to the office five days a week, why he is building an organization less dependent on managers, and how their artificial intelligence strategy differs from the rest.

title: Introducing a New Era of HBR IdeaCast
description: A new sound is in store for the HBR IdeaCast. Every Tuesday, we'll keep giving you the insights, research, and advice you need to lead, featuring practical conversations with leading thinkers. But as Adi Ignatius, editor-at-large at Harvard Business Review, joins executive editor Alison Beard as cohost of the show, we're offering even more to better serve you. Look forward to more interviews with C-suite executives, more expert perspectives on the most pressing, up-to-date problems facing leaders, and some special surprises for HBR subscribers. The new and improved HBR IdeaCast kicks off next Tuesday, be sure to hit subscribe so you don't miss an episode. Tell us what topics you'd like us to cover:¬†ideacast@hbr.org

title: #2274 1440: $20+mil / year newsletter
description: After closing a company that failed, Tim Huelskamp decided to keep it simple. He launched an email newsletter that briefed smart people about the day‚Äôs top news. Today his company, 1440, has over 4 million subscribers and generates over $20 million in annual revenue Tim Huelskamp is the co-founder of 1440, the fact-focused daily newsletter. Tim and his team are building 1440 into a trusted source for intellectually curious readers who want an inch-deep, mile-wide view of the world. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: #2273 What happened to our partnership?
description: Before I partnered with Jesse Pujji, we were buddy-buddy. Texting all the time. When we got started, we got excited about the world of possibilities for our company. Now? Something is missing. I asked him about it. And about where he put his money, why he‚Äôs not launching more companies now, what he‚Äôs building with AI, and more. Jesse Pujji is the founder of Gateway X, the venture studio. Jesse & Andrew are building Bootstrapped Giants, a resource for ambitious, unfunded founders. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: Why Knowing Yourself Is Your Greatest Asset
description: Suzy Welch is a New York Times bestselling author, and professor at NYU Stern School of Business. She‚Äôs also the creator of Becoming You, a proven method for aligning your values, aptitudes, and interests to design a purpose-driven career. In this episode, Suzy shares how her transformative framework helps individuals cut through the noise and find true clarity about who they are and what they‚Äôre meant to do. title: Give Your Marketing Strategy a Smart Upgrade
description: Keith Lauver is a serial entrepreneur, seasoned marketing strategist, and founder of Atomic Elevator, the company behind Ella‚Äîan AI-powered marketing platform transforming how brands approach strategy and execution. He has launched six companies and raised over $34 million through product-driven growth. In this episode, Keith shares how High Definition Marketing and AI tools like Ella are redefining marketing for small businesses and agencies alike. Discover how to align your marketing strategy with execution, break through brand stagnation, and drive real business growth with smarter, not louder, tactics. title: ‚ÄúWhat might this look like if it were easy?‚Äù ‚Äî A Conversation at Harvard Business School
description: Harvard¬†Business School (HBS) reached out last year to create a case study on my entrepreneurial journey. It culminated in participating in two classes at HBS in¬†Professor Reza Satchu‚Äôs ‚ÄúFounder Mindset‚Äù course. Following one of the classes, Professor Satchu and I continued the conversation at an Entrepreneurship Club event, ‚ÄúLessons on Life & Business with Tim Ferriss.‚Äù The conversation was printed in HBS's The Harbus publication and is shared here with permission. The post ‚ÄúWhat might this look like if it were easy?‚Äù ‚Äî A Conversation at Harvard Business School appeared first on The Blog of Author Tim Ferriss.

title: Tech's strong ad sales are showing signs of cracking from Trump's trade war
description: Meta, Alphabet and Amazon reported strong online advertising sales in the face of economic worries fueled by the White House's global trade overhaul.

title: Trump administration 'looking at' suspending habeas corpus for migrants, Stephen Miller says
description: Multiple court cases challenging the Trump administrations effort to deport undocumented immigrants from the U.S. are based on habeas claims.

title: IndusInd Bank to look into insider trading charge after independent probe
description: IndusInd, India's 5th-largest private sector bank, disclosed in March that years of incorrect accounting of internal derivative trades had led to a $230 million hole in its $60.8 billion balance sheet

title: Birla Corporation Q4 results: Profit up 33% to ‚Çπ257 cr; revenue up 7%
description: After a weak start to FY25, Birla Corp posts strong Q4 profit growth on higher capacity utilisation and announces major expansion to scale cement output to 27.6 mt

title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYC‚Äôs Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. Get the Side Hustle Ideas Database: https://clickhubspot.com/ogv
author: HubSpot

title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.
author: HubSpot

title: Advice Line with Richard Branson of Virgin
description: Virgin Group founder Richard Branson joins Guy on the Advice Line, where they answer questions from three early-stage founders. Plus, Richard‚Äôs recent adventures in bungee jumping, ziplining, space exploration and more‚Äîall in the name of promoting some of his brand‚Äôs latest offerings.¬†¬†¬†First we meet Lola from New York City, who‚Äôs looking to maintain a personal touch as she scales her travel accessory brand. Then Ross from Phoenix, who‚Äôs wondering how to make a splash with his above-ground¬†pool rental business. And Andrew from Cumberland Gap, Tennessee, who wants to start selling his small-batch granola in locations beyond his juice bar.Thank you to the founders of Silver & Riley, Now Pools, and The Juice Spot/Lone Wolf Granola for being a part of our show.If you‚Äôd like to be featured on a future Advice Line episode, leave us a one-minute message that tells us about your business and a specific question you‚Äôd like answered. Send a voice memo to hibt@id.wondery.com or call 1-800-433-1298.And be sure to listen to Virgin's founding story as told by Richard Branson on How I Built This in 2017.This episode was produced by Chris Maccini with music by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by John Isabella. Our audio engineer was Neal Rauch.You can follow HIBT on X & Instagram and sign up for Guy's free newsletter at guyraz.com.See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

title: Whisker/Litter-Robot: Brad Baxter
description: Brad Baxter sidelined a promising career in the car industry to build a better cat litter box ‚Äì an undertaking that embarrassed his kids and eventually prompted his wife to ask "what‚Äôs the endgame here?‚Äù That endgame turned out to be Litter-Robot, an automated self-cleaning litter-remover that helped propel Brad‚Äôs company, Whisker, to roughly $300 million in sales this year.This episode was produced by Sam Paulson with music composed by Ramtin Arablouei. It was edited by Neva Grant with research by Carla Esteves.
